root.label: Frontend Development
root.summary: Core concepts and technologies in modern frontend development
root.description: Frontend development encompasses all aspects of building user interfaces and user experiences for web applications. This mindmap explores the key technologies, frameworks, and concepts that power modern web development.

metadata.notes: This is the root node of the mindmap

children.label: Frameworks & Libraries
children.description: Modern frontend development relies heavily on frameworks and libraries that provide structure, reactivity, and reusable components. These tools help developers build complex applications more efficiently.

children.label: React
children.summary: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
children.description: React is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It lets you compose complex UIs from small and isolated pieces of code called components.

children.label: Next.js
children.description: Next.js is a React framework that enables functionality such as server-side rendering and generating static websites. It provides a great developer experience with features like automatic code splitting, optimized performance, and easy deployment.

children.label: Vue.js
children.description: Vue.js is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Unlike other monolithic frameworks, Vue is designed from the ground up to be incrementally adoptable.

children.label: Styling Solutions
children.description: Styling is crucial for creating visually appealing and responsive user interfaces. Modern development offers various approaches from utility-first CSS frameworks to CSS-in-JS solutions.

children.label: Tailwind CSS
children.description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build custom designs without leaving your HTML. It's highly customizable and enables rapid UI development.

children.label: CSS Modules
children.description: CSS Modules allow you to write CSS that is scoped to a component, preventing style conflicts and making styles more maintainable.

children.label: Styled Components
children.description: Styled Components is a CSS-in-JS library that lets you write actual CSS code to style your components. It removes the mapping between components and styles.

children.label: State Management
children.description: State management is a critical aspect of frontend development, especially for complex applications. Various solutions exist to handle local and global state efficiently.

children.label: Redux
children.description: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps. It helps you write applications that behave consistently and are easy to test.

children.label: Zustand
children.description: Zustand is a small, fast, and scalable state management solution. It has a simple API and doesn't require boilerplate code.

children.label: React Context
children.description: React Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

children.label: Development Tools
children.description: Modern frontend development relies on a variety of tools for building, testing, and optimizing applications. These tools improve developer productivity and application quality.

children.label: Webpack
children.description: Webpack is a static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications. It processes your application and builds a dependency graph.

children.label: Vite
children.description: Vite is a build tool that provides a faster and leaner development experience for modern web projects. It uses native ES modules and provides instant server start.

children.label: TypeScript
children.description: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale. It adds static type definitions to JavaScript.
